New Records: Jordan Ayew scored the winner for Ghana in their 2-1 victory over Mali in the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers.
Ghana moved to second on the Group I table with six points from three matches.
Key Match Events: Mali took the lead in injury time of the first half via a deflected shot from striker Kamory Doumbia.
Ghana got the equalizer shortly after the restart through a powerful header from Ernest Nuamah.
Jordan Ayew scored the winner for Ghana in the 90th minute from a rebound.
Post-Match Reflections: Bernard Tekpetey highlighted the impact of Jordan Ayew's substitution on Ghana's performance.
Ghana's victory moved them closer to qualifying for the 2026 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers.
Ghana's next game is against the Central African Republic on June 10, 2024.
